result.markdown:
---
date: '2024-02-26'
image: python-logo.png
categories:
  - Python
title: Python f-strings
---





Here are some examples of
[f-strings](https://docs.python.org/3/tutorial/inputoutput.html#fancier-output-formatting)
in Python inspired by a [post](https://note.nkmk.me/en/python-f-strings/)
and a [cheat sheet](https://fstring.help/cheat/).


::: {#4c71ecac .cell execution_count=1}
``` {.python .cell-code}
a = 2
b = 3
```
:::


::: {#03cc643d .cell execution_count=2}
``` {.python .cell-code}
f"{a} + {b}"
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=2}
```
'2 + 3'
```
:::
:::


::: {#3f42481f .cell execution_count=3}
``` {.python .cell-code}
f"{a=} and {b=}"
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=3}
```
'a=2 and b=3'
```
:::
:::


::: {#c6f00785 .cell execution_count=4}
``` {.python .cell-code}
f"a + b = {a+b}"
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=4}
```
'a + b = 5'
```
:::
:::


Curly brackets in an f-string

::: {#f9be7b48 .cell execution_count=5}
``` {.python .cell-code}
n = 123

f'{{}}-{n}-{{{n}}}'
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=5}
```
'{}-123-{123}'
```
:::
:::


#### Number formatting

::: {#b2dfaa71 .cell execution_count=6}
``` {.python .cell-code}
var = 1234567890.1234

f'{var:,}'
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=6}
```
'1,234,567,890.1234'
```
:::
:::


::: {#cc902acd .cell execution_count=7}
``` {.python .cell-code}
f'round: {var:.2f}'
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=7}
```
'round: 1234567890.12'
```
:::
:::


::: {#08310934 .cell execution_count=8}
``` {.python .cell-code}
f'comma: {var:,}'
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=8}
```
'comma: 1,234,567,890.1234'
```
:::
:::


::: {#8cf6da16 .cell execution_count=9}
``` {.python .cell-code}
f'comma: {var:,.2f}'
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=9}
```
'comma: 1,234,567,890.12'
```
:::
:::


::: {#d2038924 .cell execution_count=10}
``` {.python .cell-code}
import datetime

dt = datetime.datetime(2026, 2, 21, 19, 45, 30)

f'{dt}'
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=10}
```
'2026-02-21 19:45:30'
```
:::
:::


::: {#9fbc1fff .cell execution_count=11}
``` {.python .cell-code}
f'{dt:%Y-%m-%d}'
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=11}
```
'2026-02-21'
```
:::
:::


::: {#c30c8a18 .cell execution_count=12}
``` {.python .cell-code}
f'{dt.isoformat()}'
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=12}
```
'2026-02-21T19:45:30'
```
:::
:::


---
